intro: Vasconcellea carvalhoae, commonly known as the Carvalho's wax plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
